page.title: 11NETHERHALL SCHOOL
page.content: Netherhall School is a mixed 11-18 comprehensive with 1170 pupils drawn froma catchment area including Maryport,the villages of Crosby,Allonby,Flimby,Dearham,Birkby and Broughton Moor.The present school was created in 1967 following the amalgamation of Netherhall Boys and Solway Girls schools.Mr. Thurm is headmaster and there are 70 teaching staff. The school offers a full-range of examination subjects at CSE,16+,GCE 'O' and 'A' levels.There are 60 students in the 6th form.Pupils enjoy many extra curricula activities;visits to Austria,France and Germany.Pupils represent the school in all major sports.There is a drama,stamp,computer,sailing club.The Duke of Edingburgh Award scheme is ran.
